page.title: 07Education (Continued)
page.content: In the fourth year at Stiperstones you start to find out about what it will be like when you get to the Mary Webb School.There is a day when the fourth- years can go to the Mary Webb School during the summer term to be shown around the classrooms and to see the teachers.The Mary Webb School is the main comprehensive school for our area.The school was named after the writer, Mary Webb, because she lived in Pontesbury.Eleven different primary schools go to the Mary Webb School. Six hundred and seventy children attend there.There are forty-three teachers.There are thirteen subjects taught and five different lessons are taught in one day.For their further education pupils may move on to either Sixth-Form College in Shrewsbury or Shrewsbury College of Arts and Technology.
